title: 113_hr349
content: The Act titled "Preserving Marginal Lands and Protecting Farming Act of 2013" limits the conservation reserve to specific acreages for fiscal years 2013-2018. SEC. 3. INELIGIBLE LAND. The Secretary may not enroll class I or class II land in the conservation reserve unless it is enrolled as a buffer, filterstrip, or strip adjacent to a riparian area. SEC. 4. CONTRACT REQUIREMENTS. Section 1235(e) of the Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to include various types of land use for conservation purposes, such as hardwood trees, wildlife habitats, wetlands, and erosion control measures. The amendment to Section 1235(e) of the Food Security Act of 1985 includes land types like diversions, erosion control structures, flood control structures, grass strips, snow fences, and easements under the conservation reserve program. It also covers land within wellhead protection areas and near perennial streams or water bodies. The amendment to Section 1235(f) of the Food Security Act of 1985 allows for a transition option for certain farmers or ranchers, facilitating the transfer of land from a retired farmer to a beginning farmer. This includes preparing for agricultural crop planting. The Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to update certain provisions related to conservation programs, including changes to requirements for covered farmers or ranchers and final year contract conditions. The land is enrolled in the conservation stewardship program, and the required activity is consistent with the subchapter.
